intro: Tulipa giselae, commonly known as the Giselae tulip, is a rare and striking species native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It is characterized by its large, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to orange and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a desirable addition to rock gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a delicate and endangered species.
